subject: Religion & Spirituality
title: The Crusades: Holy War
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on The Crusades: Holy War.

hook.text: The Pope promised heaven to anyone who fought. Thousands marched east to reclaim Jerusalem. The result was bloody chaos.

buildup.text: In 1095, Pope Urban II called the First Crusade. Knights captured Jerusalem in 1099, massacring Muslims and Jews.

discovery.text: Nine Crusades followed over 200 years. Crusaders established kingdoms, traded with Muslims, and mostly failed.

twist.text: The Crusades deepened Muslim-Christian hostility that echoes today. They also brought spices, math, and ideas to Europe.

climax.text: The Crusades show religion's power to inspire both heroism and horror. Faith and violence are old companions.

punchline.text: Holy war promised heaven. It delivered centuries of lasting hostility.

quiz.question: What was a lasting consequence of the Crusades?
